author: info@scout.com (Gabe Brooks)
title: Army Bowl: East Defensive Preview

organizations.name: east defensive preview east army bowl defense

text:
East Army Bowl Defense (Â© AAG) Army Bowl: Breaking Down the Defensive Players for the East Gabe Brooks Yesterday at 11:45 AM / Originally published on Scout Football Scout breaks down the players on defense for the East at the U.S. Army All-American Bowl in San Antonio ... U.S. Army All-American Bowl week kicks off Monday with practices starting in San Antonio leading up to Saturday's game at noon CST at the Alamodome. Here is a breakdown of the defense for the East. Defensive Line 
The East's defensive line is spearheaded by a trio of Scout five-star prospects: tackle Aubrey Solomon , Iowa end commit A.J. Epenesa , and Ohio State end commit Chase Young . Solomon is the unit's top uncommitted prospect as the No. 20 overall recruit in the Scout 300. Seven of the group's eight players are Scout 300 prospects and four are national top 50 players.
